hf.name: Lily
hf.appearance: Small with curly red hair and freckles

xc.name: Mrs. Johnson
xc.appearance: Kind-faced woman with short blonde hair

json_to_edit.voice_over: In the most unexpected places, we find the truest lessons of humanity.
json_to_edit.description: An alien named Zorg learns about love and friendship from a young Earth girl named Lily.
json_to_edit.ambience_sound_keywords: Birds chirping, distant lawnmower, children playing
json_to_edit.name: Alien's First Lesson
json_to_edit.scene_summary: Zorg, an alien visitor, experiences human emotions through interactions with Lily and her family.

qa.action: Zorg's small spacecraft lands in the Johnsons' backyard, causing wonder and alarm.

hf.action: Zorg emerges from the spacecraft, looking around curiously at his new surroundings.

tr.action: Lily's eyes widen with excitement and curiosity as she sees Zorg for the first time.

xc.action: Lily cautiously approaches Zorg, offering him a flower from the garden.

ka.action: Mr. and Mrs. Johnson watch from the patio, torn between concern and fascination.

fn.action: Zorg gently takes the flower, his large eyes showing a mix of confusion and warmth.

af.action: Lily teaches Zorg to play pat-a-cake, their hands meeting in a moment of interspecies connection.

edit_command: Remove every second shot from the scene, but don't change anything else.

updated_json.voice_over: In the most unexpected places, we find the truest lessons of humanity.
updated_json.description: An alien named Zorg learns about love and friendship from a young Earth girl named Lily.
updated_json.ambience_sound_keywords: Birds chirping, distant lawnmower, children playing
updated_json.name: Alien's First Lesson

label.rationale: we will remove every second shot from the scene as requested, while keeping all other elements of the json intact. this means we'll remove shots with keys "hf", "xc", and "fn" from the "shots" object. we'll also update the "list_display_order" to reflect this change. the "number_of_shots" will be updated from "7" to "4" to accurately represent the new number of shots in the scene. all other elements of the json, including the characters, voice over, description, location, and other scene details, will remain unchanged.
